thread.title: Runners, walkers to converge on downtown for annual marathon
thread.title_full: Runners, walkers to converge on downtown for annual marathon

title: Runners, walkers to converge on downtown for annual marathon
text:
Downtown Detroit preparing for thousands of runners, walkers in annual marathon THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   4:01   4:01   
Subjects: 
Michigan (860) 

DETROIT â€” The 38th annual Detroit Free Press/Talmer Bank Marathon returns to downtown Detroit and surrounding neighborhoods. 
The 26.2-mile race begins Sunday morning. 
Sendoffs will begin about 7 a.m. for smaller groups of participants to ease early course congestion. The event also features half marathons in the United States and Windsor, Ontario, in Canada, a disability division and a relay. 
More than 27,000 people registered for last year's events. 
For security reasons, runners must use clear plastic bags to store gear they want to check. The bags are provided.
